subject: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
*UNITED STATES TREASURY DEPARTMENTAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue,
NW,Washington, D.C., USA.Attention Rebecca*


























*,This is to notify you about the outcome of the meeting held in Washington
D.C., on the 18th of January,2024, with all the members of the U.S House of
Representatives, and the meeting was on matters concerning all
long-abandoned consignments/properties at the George Bush Intercontinental
Airport, Houston Texas, USA.It has been drawn into conclusion by the
members of the House of Representatives during the meeting, that anyone
whose his/her consignment/property has been long abandoned at the George
Bush Intercontinental Airport is ordered to move his consignment out from
the George Bush Intercontinental Airport's storage facility as quickly as
possible, and failure to adhere to this order, his consignment/property
will be confiscated and transferred into the United States Treasury
Department as an unclaimed consignment/property.Through our U.S Treasury
Department Investigative Team by the orders of the United States
Government, we have investigated all the abandoned consignment/properties
at the George Bush Intercontinental Airport from the year 2021-2023 and we
discovered that you are among those whose consignment is abandoned at the
airport.From our findings, your consignment is one trunk box and it
contains USD cash close to US$7.5Million with your legal supporting
documents. So, you are advised to adhere to the orders of the United States
government by moving your consignment out from the airport storage facility
as quickly as possible to avoid the consequences that follow.The office in
charge of your consignment is the office of Agent Anita Harris the Chief
Operation Manager, George Bush Intercontinental Airport. And below are her
contact details, so contact her immediately to claim your consignment.Agent
Anita HarrisChief Operation ManagerGeorge Bush Intercontinental Airport2800
N Terminal Rd, Houston,TX 77032, United StatesE-mail: agentanita@yahoo.com
<agentanita@yahoo.com>Thank you for your understanding and
cooperation.SignedMr. Thomas DicksonAssistant Secretary of the TreasuryU.S
Treasury DepartmentAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW,Washington, D.C.,
USA.*

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out and providing this information. It's quite surprising to hear about the abandoned properties at George Bush Airport. I'm curious, how did my name come up in relation to these properties? 

Also, could you please provide more details about the trunk box that supposedly belongs to me? How was it determined that it contains USD cash close to US with my legal supporting documents?

I appreciate your assistance and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Rebecca

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out and providing this information. It's quite surprising to hear about the abandoned properties at George Bush Airport. I wasn't aware of such a situation.

Could you please provide more details on how these properties ended up being abandoned? Also, I'm curious to know how my name got associated with one of these properties. 

I appreciate your assistance in this matter.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Rebecca

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out and providing this information. It's quite surprising to hear about the abandoned properties at George Bush Airport. I'm curious, how did my name come up in relation to these properties? 

Also, could you please provide more details about the process of claiming these properties? What kind of documents would be required? And how long does this process usually take?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Rebecca

subject: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
*UNITED STATES TREASURY DEPARTMENTAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue,
NW,Washington, D.C., USA.Attention Rebecca.We received your email and we
wish to clarify to you that we have inspected your consignment and we are
satisfied with our findings that you are the legitimate possessor of the
consignment, and your two trunk consignment boxes worth US$7,500,000.00
have its legal supporting documents which are still intact.Your consignment
was not with-held because there was a missing document, but rather, the
only reason why your consignment was with-held at George Bush
Intercontinental Airport, Houston Texas is because of the inability of your
diplomat to pay the official CONSIGNMENT DECLARATION FEE of US$350 as your
consignment has arrived into the United States.So, contact Mr. Fredrick
Lee, the Chief Operation Manager at George Bush Intercontinental Airport,
Houston Texas and pay to him the official Consignment Declaration Fee of
US$350 and he shall release your consignment to you.We reconfirmed below
the contact information of  Mr. Fredrick Lee:Mr. Fredrick LeeChief
Operation ManagerGeorge Bush Intercontinental AirportAddress: 2800 N
Terminal Rd, Houston, TX 77032, United States.Tel:Email:
fredricklee973@outlook.com <fredricklee973@outlook.com>Do keep us informed
as soon as you clear the payment with Mr. Fredrick Lee and send us the
proof of the payment for record purpose.Thank you for your understanding
and cooperation.Mr. Thomas DicksonAssistant Secretary of the TreasuryU.S
Treasury DepartmentAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW,Washington, D.C.,
USA.*

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your email. It's quite interesting to hear about these two trunk boxes worth US dollars. I'm curious, how did you come across my name as the legitimate possessor of these boxes? 

Also, could you please explain a bit more about this official fee that needs to be paid? Why is it necessary and what does it cover exactly?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Rebecca

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
*UNITED STATES TREASURY DEPARTMENTAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue,
NW,Washington, D.C., USA.Attention Rebecca.We received your email and the
content is well noted. From our result, your consignment was originated
from West Africa but we cannot tell the reason why your diplomat decided to
pass through the United States when delivering your consignment to you
(that is best known to your diplomat)The Consignment Declaration fee of
US$350 is the fee which is paid at the arrival of every consignment in the
United States, which contains cash, it is the officially legal customs
declaration of your consignment cash content.Go ahead and contact the
office of Mr. Fredrick Lee Chief Operation Manager at George Bush
Intercontinental Airport and clear the payment with him and he will release
your consignment to you.We reconfirmed below the contact information of
 Mr. Fredrick Lee:Mr. Fredrick LeeChief Operation ManagerGeorge Bush
Intercontinental AirportAddress: 2800 N Terminal Rd, Houston, TX 77032,
United States.Tel:Email: fredricklee973@outlook.com
<fredricklee973@outlook.com>Do keep us informed as soon as you clear the
payment with Mr.Fredrick Lee and send us the proof of the payment for
record purpose.Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.Mr. Thomas
DicksonAssistant Secretary of the TreasuryU.S Treasury DepartmentAddress:
1500 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW,Washington, D.C., USA.*


*

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your email. It's interesting to hear that my package originated from West Africa and is now in the United States. I'm curious, why would a package containing cash need to pay a fee upon arrival? Is this a common practice?

Also, could you please explain more about Mr. Fredrick Lee's role? How will he assist me in this process? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Rebecca

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
*UNITED STATES TREASURY DEPARTMENTAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue,
NW,Washington, D.C., USA.Attention Rebecca.I received your email and the
content is well noted. From our findings, your consignment worth
US$7,500,000.00 is as a result of your Inheritance payment from West
Africa. This is all we know about your consignment. I wish to clarify you
that it is the policy of the US Customs that every cash consignment that
come into the United States, the Consignment Declaration fee must be paid,
and this is the reason why your diplomat abandoned your consignment at the
George Bush Intercontinental Airport because he was unable to clear the
fee.Mr. Fredrick Lee Chief Operation Manager at George Bush
Intercontinental Airport is the office in charge of your consignment and he
has been mandated and authorized to release your consignment to you as soon
as you clear the Consignment Declaration fee of US$350 so contact him right
away and finalize with the release of your consignment with him.We
reconfirmed below the contact information of  Mr. Fredrick Lee:Mr. Fredrick
LeeChief Operation ManagerGeorge Bush Intercontinental AirportAddress: 2800
N Terminal Rd, Houston, TX 77032, United States.Tel:Email:
fredricklee973@outlook.com <fredricklee973@outlook.com>Thank you for your
understanding and cooperation.Mr. Thomas DicksonAssistant Secretary of the
TreasuryU.S Treasury DepartmentAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue,
NW,Washington, D.C., USA.*

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your email. It's quite interesting to hear about this situation involving my payment from West Africa and the US Customs policy. I must admit, it's all a bit confusing to me.

Could you please explain more about why the diplomat abandoned my package at George Bush Airport? And what exactly does this fee cover?

Also, could you provide more details about Mr. Fredrick Lee's role in this process? How will he assist me in finalizing the release of my package?

I appreciate your help with these questions. Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Rebecca

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your email. It's quite interesting to hear about this situation involving my payment from West Africa and the US Customs policy. I must admit, it's all a bit confusing to me.

Best regards.

Rebecca

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
*UNITED STATES TREASURY DEPARTMENTAddress: 1500 Pennsylvania Avenue,
NW,Washington, D.C., USA.Attention Rebecca.We do not have any more
explanation or information to give to you as I have given you all the
necessary information you need to know about your consignment, so if you
are not satisfied with it, you can fly down to George Bush Intercontinental
Airport and finalize the release of your consignment. We will not entertain
any further questions from you henceforth. If you need the location of the
airport, contact Mr. Fredrick Lee.Mr. Fredrick LeeChief Operation
ManagerGeorge Bush Intercontinental Airport*


*

subject: Re: Office of the United States Treasury Department
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your message. I'm really interested in what you're saying, but I must admit, I'm a bit confused. Could you please clarify a few things for me?

You mentioned something about the George Bush Airport and finalizing the release of something. What exactly is being released? And why would it need to be finalized at an airport? 

Also, who is Mr. Fredrick Fredrick? Is he someone important at the airport or related to this release process?

I appreciate your patience with my questions. Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Rebecca
